pullrequest.title: Added Shape::ComputeVolume and implementations for simple shapes

content.raw: Good point. I think [physics_collision.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/db21d55d82b78112a590d6dcd4bac33fb0fff61e/test/integration/physics_collision.cc) would be the right place for a generic test, but you could also sneak it into [test/integration/polyline.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/db21d55d82b78112a590d6dcd4bac33fb0fff61e/test/integration/polyline.cc?at=default), since that already has an example world. I would recommend the [cube model from polyline.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/db21d55d82b78112a590d6dcd4bac33fb0fff61e/worlds/polyline.world?at=default#cl-101) (which is oddly 1x1x1.5 and not actually a cube).
content.html: Good point. I think physics_collision.cc would be the right place for a generic test, but you could also sneak it into test/integration/polyline.cc, since that already has an example world. I would recommend the cube model from polyline.world (which is oddly 1x1x1.5 and not actually a cube).
